BiblioData.Title: USE OF NANODISPERSIONS TO PROTECT WATER- SOLUBLE INGREDIENTS IN COSMETIC END FORMULATIONS
BiblioData.Abstract: The invention describes the use of a nanodispersion, which comprises: a) a membrane-forming molecule, b) a coemulsifier, c) a lipophilic component, and d) a water-soluble ingredient sensitive to oxidation in cosmetic end formulations, the nanodispersion being obtainable by (a) mixing the components (a), (b) and (c) until a homogeneous liquid is obtained (so-called nanodispersion pre-phase), and (ss) adding the water or aqueous phase (discontinuous phase) which contains the water-soluble ingredient and optionally the non-aqueous polar organic solvent to the liquid obtained in step (a). Component (d) is preferably ascorbic acid or vitamin C.

Claims.P: What is claimed is:
1. Use of a nanodispersion, which comprises
(a) a membrane-forming molecule,
(b) a coemulsifier,
(c) a lipophilic component, and
(d) a water-soluble ingredient sensitive to oxidation

in cosmetic end formulations, the nanodispersion being obtainable by ([alpha]) mixing the components (a), (b) and (c) until a homogeneous liquid is obtained (so-called nanodispersion pre- phase), and ([beta]) adding the water or aqueous phase (discontinuous phase) which contains the water-soluble ingredient and optionally the non-aqueous polar organic solvent to the liquid obtained in step ([alpha]).
2. Use according to claim 1 wherein component (d) is ascorbic acid or vitamin C.
3. Use according to claim 1 , wherein the non-aqueous polar organic solvents are polyols, homopolymeric or block copolymeric liquid ethers.
4. Use according to claim 1 , wherein step ([alpha]) is carried out in anhydrous medium.
5. Use according to claim 1 , wherein step ([beta]) is carried out without homogenisation.
6. Use according to claim 1 , wherein the particles in the nanodispersion have an average diameter of <100 nm.
7. Use according to claim 1 , comprising additionally a component (e) which is an antioxidant.
